data.title: Our Golf Instructors
data.meta_description: We have some of the best golf instructors in the country, all with outstanding credentials. All guiding players from all levels to maximize their game.
data.text:
Jack Lumpkin

In Memoriam

Senior Director of Instruction

“One of America’s 50 Greatest Teachers” – Golf Digest (every year since 2000)

Georgia Hall of Fame and Athens, Georgia Athletic Hall of Fame, and Golf Magazine Hall of Fame inductee.

Leader, mentor, visionary. But most of all, friend. Jack Lumpkin was a part of the Sea Island family for 33 years.

Long recognized as one of America’s top golf instructors. Lead teacher at Golf Digest schools around the world for 24 years. Accomplished player, including qualifying for three U.S. Opens and one PGA Championship. Co-designer of our first Golf Performance Center and creator of our teaching foundation. In fact, the very spot where he used to take his students to block out the north wind (once known as Lumpkin’s Tee), is where our new facility now stands. Jack Lumpkin was more than our Director of Instruction, he was a true legend. An example to us all in how he carried himself every day. We’ll always remember the lessons he taught us, the lasting relationships he created, and the joy and excitement he held for doing what he loved to do. His legacy will live on here at Sea Island.

Craig Allan

Golf Performance Center Director & Master Club Fitter

Titleist Regional Fitting Center, 2007-2019

Titleist Premier Fitting Partner, 2020-present

Titleist Top 100 Fitter, 2004-present

Mizuno Top 50 Fitter, 2004, 2008-2010, 2012-present

Mizuno Top 100 Fitter, 2005, 2011

Ping Regional Fitter of the Year, 2004, 2007, 2011, 2016, 2021

Taylormade Tuned Performance Premier Fitter, 2013-2018

TaylorMade Premier Fitting Center, 2019-present

TaylorMade National Fitting Council, 2018-present

Top 100 Fitter, 2013-present – Golf Digest

Craig Allan received his initial Club Fitting in South Africa, and since graduating college in Alabama, has worked at several well-recognized facilities in the Southeast. Allan is a nationally renowned fitter who is certified at the highest level with all major club companies’ fitting systems and has extensive experience with the Trackman Launch Monitor.

PGA TOUR Students: Davis Love III, Zach Johnson, Brian Harman, Harris English, Jonathan Byrd, Garrick Higgo, and Keith Mitchell

Gale Peterson

Elite Instructor

LPGA Top 50 Teachers 2022-2023

Top 100 Teachers, 2012, 2017, 2021, 2024 – Golf Magazine

LPGA National Teacher of the Year

Georgia PGA Teacher of the Year

America’s Top 50 Teachers, 2002–2012

Top 50 Women Teachers, 2014 – Golf Digest

Top 100 Teachers, 2012, 2017 – Golf Magazine

Top 50 Teachers, 2012 – Golf for Women

Top 10 Golf Teacher, – Black Ink

A PGA and LPGA Member, Gale Peterson has taught at Sea Island for more than 30 years. Peterson is one of the mentors/presenters for LPGA, PGA AND NCAA Women’s Coaches Educational Programs throughout the country. She is on the Board of Directors for LPGA Education Division and the PGA National Education Board. Peterson’s experience has earned her numerous accolades, including National LPGA Teacher of the Year, Golf Magazine’s Top 100 Teachers and LPGA’s Top 50 Teachers. Peterson has appeared as a guest instructor on national television broadcasts such as the Golf Channel, ESPN, FOX and NBC’s Today. Peterson co-authored LPGA’s Guide to Every Shot and is a contributor to FOX Sports “Inside Golf Magazine,” Golfer’s MD, and Golf Magazine. She continues to instruct players of all talents and ages and prides herself on helping players reach their potential and become their own best coach. Personalities such as Sam Nunn, Bob Schieffer, Marguerite Salle, and Mort Kondracke have worked with Gale to improve their games and become their own best coach. Gale teaches all aspects of the game and specializes in wedge play.

LPGA Tour Students: Dori Carter, Karlin Beck, Alison Whitaker, and Stephanie Connelly

Dr. Morris Pickens

Sports Psychologist and Performance Specialist

Students have 30 PGA TOUR wins since 2005

Three students have won four Majors (Masters, 2007, Zach Johnson; US Open, 2009, Lucas Glover; Open Champion, 2009, Stewart Cink; Open Champion, 2015, Zach Johnson)

More than 300 wins by amateur students of all levels (junior, college, and amateur)

Has had six students ranked as the #1 amateur in the U.S. by GolfWeek

Seven college teams have won numerous tournaments including one National Championship (Clemson, 2003)

Dr. Morris M. Pickens received his Ph.D. in sports psychology from the University of Virginia in 1995. During this time, he focused his research and consulting interests in the area of golf psychology, specifically the acquisition of putting confidence. Dr. Pickens has provided sports psychology consulting for numerous PGA, LPGA, KornFerry, and Champions tour players and authored The Winning Way in Golf and Life. In addition to working with professional golfers, Dr. Pickens has also provided performance enhancement consulting for other athletes including the NFL and MLB, and conducts leadership seminars for companies of all sizes.

Current and Former PGA TOUR Students: Zach Johnson, Jonathan Byrd, Stewart Cink, Kyle Reifers, John Rollins, Blayne Barber, Nick Watney, Keegan Bradley, Chris Stroud, Justin Leonard, Will Gordon, and Davis Thompson.

Randy Myers

Director of Fitness

Nike Golf Performance—Swoosh Advisory Staff

Presenter at several PGA Teaching and Coaching Summits

50 Best Golf-Fitness Trainers in America/Advisory staff – Golf Digest

30+ years of experience as a trainer on the PGA TOUR

Titleist Performance Institute founding advisor

Titleist Performance Institute Hall of Fame inaugural class – 2019

Srixon Golf staff member

Ryder Cup USA Performance Trainer,, 2012, 2016, 2018, 2021, 2023

Multiple guest appearances on Golf Channel

Randy Myers joined Sea Island as Director of Fitness in 2005, having previously served as Director of Fitness and Personal Training at PGA National Resort & Spa since 1992. Myers’ Master’s thesis topic, “A strength training and flexibility program for recreational golfers,” helped establish the standards for golf exercise conditioning. His articles have been featured in Sports Illustrated, Golf Digest, and PGATOUR.com, and authored Fit for Life Fit for Golf. Over his thirty-year career, Randy has designed fitness programs for elite junior golfers, college golf teams, and winners on the LPGA and PGA TOUR. His passion for providing cutting-edge performance programs extends to recreational golfers as well as the best players in the world.

PGA TOUR Students: Davis Love III, Lucas Glover, Jonathan Byrd, Charles Howell III, Zach Johnson, Chris Kirk, David Toms, Brendon deJonge, Brian Harman, Luke Gutherie, Justin Leonard, and Billy Horschel.

Phil Kenyon

Director of Putting Instruction

“One of the Best International Teachers” – Golf Digest

Callaway Golf and Odyssey Ambassador

John Jacobs Award for Teaching & Coaching

PGA Master Professional

MSc Sports Science

BSc (Hons) in Applied Psychology and Sport Science

Award Winning Teaching Professional

Consultant to multiple PGAs/Federations

Phil is one of the most sought-after specialist putting coaches in the world and has worked with many of the world-leading players. Before developing a career as a coach, Phil was a professional golfer who competed worldwide as a tournament professional. Prior to his career in professional golf, Phil completed a Master’s Degree in Sports Science. Phil’s background in sports science brings a cutting edge to putting instruction which when combined with his experiences as both player and coach means that his putting instruction is always pushing the limits and looking for new ways to help golfers.

Past and Present Students: Matt Fitzpatrick, Keegan Bradley, Brooks Koepka, Max Homa, Rory McIlroy, Henrik Stenson, Gary Woodland, Justin Rose, Lee Westwood, Martin Kaymer, Tommy Fleetwood, and Francesco Molinari

Ryan Smith

Elite Instructor

“One of America’s Best Young Teachers” – Golf Digest

Best Teacher in State, 2022-23 – Golf Digest

Best Young Teacher in America, 2021-2024 – Golf Digest

U.S Kids Golf Top 50 Master Teacher, 2016-2018

Ryan’s teaching career began in Greensboro, North Carolina, in 2014, where he refined his teaching skills under the guidance of PGA Hall of Fame Teacher Rick Murphy. His passion for player development led him to seek knowledge and expertise in coaching and human performance from experts across the world, including PGA Tour coaches, fitness professionals, and Ph.D.s. Ryan holds numerous certifications in teaching and coaching, motor learning, and biomechanics, specializing in developing golfers of all skill levels, with a particular focus on elite junior and college athletes. His dedication and expertise in golf instruction earned him the honor of being the keynote speaker at the 2023 CPGA Teaching Summit, and he was named by Golf Digest as one of the ‘Best Young Teachers in America’ in 2021-22 and again in 2023-24. He was ranked #14 in the 2022-23 ‘Best Teachers in South Carolina.’ In 2016, 2017, and 2018, Ryan was selected as a Top 50 Master Teacher by the U.S. Kids Golf Foundation for his exemplary work and dedication to the growth and development of youth golf.

Jared Zak

Elite Instructor

“Best Teachers in Your State”- Golf Digest 2022/2023

“One of America’s Best Young Teachers” – Golf Digest

#7, Top Instructors in Georgia, 2009 – Golf Digest

Jared Zak, a PGA Professional since 2000, began teaching at Sea Island in 1999. Zak has taught in golf schools under the direction of Bob Toski, Mac O’Grady, Butch Harmon, and Ben Doyle. He has also trained under the expert direction of renowned professionals Jack Lumpkin, Todd Anderson, and Scott Davenport. Named one of the top 20 instructors under the age of 40 by Golf Digest, Zak also was named by Golf Digest as one of the top 10 instructors in Georgia. His teaching has helped develop top-ranking junior and collegiate players who have gone on to compete at the next level. Zak enjoys working with players who are focused on improving their game and lowering their scores.

Past and Present Students: Katie Burnett, Scott Langley, and Austin Morrison

Justin Parsons

Elite Instructor

Top 100 Teachers, 2024 – Golf Magazine

Best in State Georgia, 2021 – Golf Digest

Titleist Brand Ambassador

Justin Parsons is originally from Killinchy in Northern Ireland. He joined our team after serving as the Director of Instruction at The Butch Harmon School of Golf in Dubai since 2008 where he had the opportunity to be mentored by Butch Harmon and his son and respected coach, Claude Harmon III. Justin is a Titleist Advisory Staff member and a Titleist Performance Institute Level 3 Golf Professional Certified coach. He is a specialist in 3D analysis and functional movement screening. Since his arrival in 2019, Justin has enjoyed success with players he assists winning events on the Korn Ferry, PGA Tour, appearing in the Ryder Cup, Presidents Cup and twinning the Open Championship.

TOUR Students: Davis Love III, Brian Harman, Harris English, Louis Oosthuizen, Branden Grace, Patton Kizzire, Will Gordon, Luke List, Tyson Alexander, Ben Martin, and Ben Kohles

Chan Reeves

Elite Instructor

Georgia PGA North Chapter Teacher of the Year, 2002, 2005

Georgia PGA Section Teacher of the Year, 2005

Chan was born in Americus, GA, and played collegiately at Georgia Tech from 1987-1991. As a junior golfer, he learned to play the game from Davis Love, Jr. and Jimmy Hodges at the Sea Island Golf Club. After college, he played professionally for three years and then started his career in the golf business at Ansley Golf Club in Atlanta in 1995. In March of 1997, Chan moved to the Atlanta Athletic Club where he taught all levels of players both as a Teaching Professional and Director of Instruction over a 24-year period. He has helped more than 40 juniors both male and female reach their goal of playing collegiate golf. Chan joined the Sea Island Golf Performance Center in 2021 as an Elite Instructor.

TOUR Students: Keith Mitchell and Michael Thompson
